text: The University of Milan is a public university in Milan, Italy. == History == The University of Milan was founded in 1924 by merging Accademia Scientifico- Letteraria (Scientific-Literary Academy) since 1861 and Istituti Clinici di Perfezionamento (Clinical Specialisation Institutes) since 1906. There were four schools â€“ Law, Humanities, Medicine, and Natural Sciences. In the 1960s, the number of people entering Italian universities increased and the University of Milan enrolled more than 60,000 students. In 1998, the University split in two and University of Milan-Bicocca was founded. The University of Insubria was also established in Varese. == Organization == * Faculty of Agricultural and Food Sciences * Faculty of Humanities * Faculty of Law * Faculty of Medicine * Faculty of Pharmacy * Faculty of Political, Economic and Social Sciences * Faculty of Science and Technology * Faculty of Veterinary Medicine * School of Exercise and Sport Sciences * School of Language Mediation and Intercultural Communication == References == Category:1924 establishments in Italy Milan Category:Organizations based in Milan
title: University of Milan
